meanings.definition: To become more relaxed or calm.
meanings.sent1: After a long day, she mellowed out on the cozy couch.
meanings.sent2: The music mellowed his mood after a stressful week.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy cat mellowed when offered a warm blanket.
meanings.sent4: The storm mellowed into a gentle rain as the evening approached.
meanings.sent5: The soothing tea mellowed her nerves before the important presentation.

meanings.definition: To become softer or more mature in flavor.
meanings.sent1: The cheese mellowed with age, developing a rich taste.
meanings.sent2: The wine mellowed over time, enhancing its fruity notes.
meanings.sent3: The spicy curry mellowed with a touch of creamy coconut milk.
meanings.sent4: The harsh bitterness of the coffee mellowed into a smooth blend.
meanings.sent5: The flavors of the stew mellowed together, creating a delicious harmony.

meanings.definition: To become more gentle or kind.
meanings.sent1: As he grew older, his personality mellowed into a caring nature.
meanings.sent2: Her stern demeanor mellowed when she met the playful puppy.
meanings.sent3: The strict teacher mellowed her rules for the class picnic.
meanings.sent4: His harsh words mellowed into heartfelt apologies the next day.
meanings.sent5: The once fierce warrior mellowed into a compassionate leader over time.
